content.title: Venous Ulcer Management
content.definition: A comprehensive approach to treating chronic venous leg ulcers, the most common type of leg ulcer, caused by sustained venous hypertension and chronic venous insufficiency.

clinical_features.history: Duration, recurrence, previous treatments, risk factors

clinical_features.mechanism: Reduces venous hypertension, improves calf pump
clinical_features.pressure: 30-40 mmHg at ankle for therapeutic effect
clinical_features.evidence: Most effective single intervention for healing

clinical_features.infection: Treat clinical infection with systemic antibiotics
clinical_features.dressings: Absorptive dressings for exudate, maintain moist environment
clinical_features.npwt: Negative pressure for selected non-healing ulcers

clinical_features.recurrence: Up to 70% recurrence without ongoing compression

content.statement: Venous Ulcer Management is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Wound-Care that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Venous Ulcer Management helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Venous Ulcer Management include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Venous Ulcer Management.
